# Apply for event badge

If you are \(one of\) the organizers of an amazing event which is Open Source technologies and systems related, you are eligible to apply a D&I badge to measure how diversity and inclusion the event is.

## Event Definition

**Events** refer to tech get-togethers, conferences, festivals, and any other tech event that promote tech-related concepts, mostly in-person meetups, but virtual events are also included.

#### **Virtual Events**

TBD. Definition

#### **In**-Person Events

TBD. Definition

## Event submission requirements

### Event status related requirements

* The event must be about Open Source technologies and practices.
* You should be an organizer of an Event you are applying for.

### Metric related requirements

* The information about the event must be publicly available, for example on a website.
* Important contact information must be available for potential attendees and speakers.
* The event must have a Code of Conduct hosted on the website.

## Click the Button Below to Apply for Event Badge

[![Alt Text](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Click%20Here%20To%20Apply-passing?style=flat-square&link=http://left&link=https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/blob/master/submission/guidelines.md&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://chaoss.community/diversity-and-inclusion-badging/)

By clicking the button, you will be redirected to the submission form page on CHAOSS website. As an applicant, you should read the following documents:

* [Applicant role](https://github.com/badging/diversity-and-inclusion/blob/master/roles/applicant.md) 
* [Event submission requirements](https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/blob/master/submission/requirements.md)
* [Event submission guidelines](https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/blob/master/submission/guidelines.md)

You will see on the website that you can submit your event either as an In-Person Event or a Virtual Event. The biggest difference between these two kinds of events when filling the submission form is Virtual Event does not measure the Family Friendliness metric.

![](../../.gitbook/assets/image%20%286%29.png)

After filling in all the questions of the form, clicking the "Submit" button and this will redirect you to GitHub and generate an Issue for you under the event-diversity-inclusion-badging repository. 



{% hint style="info" %}
The table of the submitted event list will not be updated by themselves, since applicants do not need to edit this markdown file to submit the application.
{% endhint %}

| Date                                                                                                                     | Event Name                   | Badge | Application Issue link |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Feb-01-2020 | Example Event | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Pending-red?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) |  |
| Feb-16-2020 | Mock Event \(The Beenz Meetup\) | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Passing-passing?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) | [https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/issues/4](https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/issues/46) |

## Badge levels

Four statuses exist for the Diversity and Inclusion Event Badging:

| Level | Badge | Percentage of Requirements Met |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Pending | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Pending-red?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) | Less than 40% |
| Passing | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Passing-passing?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) | Greater than or equal to 40% and less than 60% |
| Silver | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-Silver-silver?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) | Greater than or equal to 60% and less than 80% |
| Gold | ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/D%26I-GOLD-yellow?style=flat-square&labelColor=583586&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,) | Greater than 80% |

Badges are assigned according to how the Reviewers mark out the [review checklist](https://github.com/badging/event-diversity-and-inclusion/blob/master/.github/checklist.md) according to the information initially filled in by the Applicant.

The percentages are calculated excluding the initial checks, based on the average of checklists of at least two reviewers.
